p: Carnosol, carnosic acid, and rosmanol are the most abundant phytochemical constituents of Rosmarinus officinalis and Salvia species, whereby they contribute to approximately 90% of the total antioxidant capacity of Lamiaceae [ 9]. Rosmanol and carnosol have been reported to display significant antioxidant capacity, in a competitive manner with tocopherol [ 18, 19]. These reported data corroborate with our findings.
